availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Logan County, Kentucky, physician. Kentucky native. Married to Margaret E. Kennedy in Logan County on October 9, 1848. Father of Bettie R. Bailey, Emma Bailey, Florence Bailey, and Daniel Bailey. Physician in Logan County in 1850. Owned ten enslaved persons in 1850. Physician in Logan County in 1860. Owned thirteen enslaved persons in 1860. Served as surgeon in the 26th Kentucky Volunteer Infantry (U.S.A.) from March 8, 1862, to April 10, 1862. Member of the House of Representatives of the Commonwealth of Kentucky from 1862 to 1865.
